headline: Stocks Fall After Report Raises Concerns About AI Profitability
summary: U.S. stocks slipped Tuesday after a report raised questions about the profitability of renting out artificial-intelligence computing power.  Other tech companies also fell, with  Alphabet  losing 1.9% and  CoreWeave  dropping 3.8%.  “The thing that is on everyone’s mind is: What is the business and the profitability of AI?” said  Michael Antonelli,  a market strategist at Baird.

raw.summary: U.S. stocks slipped Tuesday after a report raised questions about the profitability of renting out artificial-intelligence computing power.  Other tech companies also fell, with  Alphabet  losing 1.9% and  CoreWeave  dropping 3.8%.  “The thing that is on everyone’s mind is: What is the business and the profitability of AI?” said  Michael Antonelli,  a market strategist at Baird.

headline: The AI Bubble Is Here. Why You Can Still Play the Stocks.
summary: Seaport Global analyst Jay  Goldberg is firmly in the bubble camp.  While chips are a critical part of the AI chain, he’s not sure that the business cycles are synced: “So saying that ASML,  Applied Materials Lam Research  and  KLA  are AI stories is a bit of stretch, but AI is definitely one of many important drivers of their business.”

While chips are a critical part of the AI chain, he’s not sure that the business cycles are synced: “So saying that ASML,  Applied Materials Lam Research  and  KLA  are AI stories is a bit of stretch, but AI is definitely one of many important drivers of their business.”

headline: S&P 500 Snaps Win Streak as AI Rally Pauses
summary: The Nasdaq Composite fell 0.7%.  The S&P and Nasdaq actually hit their highest intraday levels on record earlier in the morning, but riskier assets and those tied to the AI trade turned south as consumer staples, utilities, financials, and health care stocks gained steam.  Oracle rebounded a bit after Fox Business anchor Liz Claman reported, citing sources familiar to the situation, that the report on Oracle “does not reflect the actual financials of that business.”

Oracle rebounded a bit after Fox Business anchor Liz Claman reported, citing sources familiar to the situation, that the report on Oracle “does not reflect the actual financials of that business.”

headline: Oracle Sinks on Report Its Cloud Margins Are Lower Than Expected
summary: While Oracle generated roughly $900 million in revenue from the rental of servers powered by Nvidia Corp. chips during the three months ended in August, the company only managed about $125 million in gross profit, the Information reported, citing internal corporate documents.  In some cases, Oracle was losing “considerable” amounts of money on its rentals of smaller quantities of Nvidia chips, including both new and old graphics processing units, according to the report.  Oracle shares have jumped around 70% this year as soaring demand for artificial intelligence computing has boosted the company’s revenue growth.

raw.headline: Oracle Sinks on Report Its Cloud Margins Are Lower Than Expected
raw.summary: While Oracle generated roughly $900 million in revenue from the rental of servers powered by Nvidia Corp. chips during the three months ended in August, the company only managed about $125 million in gross profit, the Information reported, citing internal corporate documents.  In some cases, Oracle was losing “considerable” amounts of money on its rentals of smaller quantities of Nvidia chips, including both new and old graphics processing units, according to the report.  Oracle shares have jumped around 70% this year as soaring demand for artificial intelligence computing has boosted the company’s revenue growth.

headline: Oracle Stock Slides On Report Its Cloud Business Is Seeing Lower Margins On Nvidia Chips
summary: Oracle stock slid Tuesday following a report that the company has slim profit margins on AI cloud computing compared to the rest of its business.  AI bullishness and cloud growth has been key to Oracle stock's rally over the past 12 months.  Oracle collected roughly $900 million in revenue but only $125 million in gross profit from renting cloud-based servers with Nvidia chips to other businesses during its August-ended quarter, according to a report from The Information, which cited internal documents.

raw.headline: Oracle Stock Slides On Report Its Cloud Business Is Seeing Lower Margins On Nvidia Chips

AI bullishness and cloud growth has been key to Oracle stock's rally over the past 12 months.  Oracle collected roughly $900 million in revenue but only $125 million in gross profit from renting cloud-based servers with Nvidia chips to other businesses during its August-ended quarter, according to a report from The Information, which cited internal documents.

headline: Oracle drags tech, Ford disrupted by plant fire, AppLovin & SEC
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Josh Lipton tracks Tuesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Oracle (ORCL) is leading tech stocks lower, reversing US markets' (^DJI, ^GSPC, ^IXIC) record-setting run. Ford (FORD) stock is under pressure after a fire broke out at a Ford supplier's plant, according to the Wall Street Journal. AppLovin (APP) stock is rebounding despite reportedly facing a Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) investigation. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Oracle Health Powers Rural Health Innovation and Transformation
summary: During the Rural Transformation Planning Summit, Oracle reaffirmed its commitment to improving rural health and provided detailed recommendations to help states maximize the opportunity of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services' Rural Health Transformation Program, which aims to drive system-wide changes to improve healthcare access, quality of care, workforce development, and patient experiences.

headline: At $1.2 Trillion, More High-Grade Debt Now Tied to AI Than Banks
summary: AI companies now make up 14% of the high-grade market from 11.5% in 2020, surpassing US banks, the largest sector on the JPMorgan US Liquid Index (JULI) index at 11.7%, JPMorgan analysts including Nathaniel Rosenbaum and Erica Spear wrote in a note Monday.  The analysts identified 75 companies across tech, utilities and capital goods sectors that are closely tied to AI, including Oracle Corp., Apple Inc. and Duke Energy Corp. Many of these firms are prolific debt issuers and in the case of tech, they are cash rich with very low net debt.

raw.headline: At $1.2 Trillion, More High-Grade Debt Now Tied to AI Than Banks

The analysts identified 75 companies across tech, utilities and capital goods sectors that are closely tied to AI, including Oracle Corp., Apple Inc. and Duke Energy Corp. Many of these firms are prolific debt issuers and in the case of tech, they are cash rich with very low net debt.

(NYSE: EPAM), a leading digital transformation services and product engineering company, today announced it has expanded its collaboration with Oracle to help enterprises across industries — including healthcare, life sciences, financial services and insurance — to integrate Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) and AI services into their cloud strategies.

headline: Dot-Com Fears Rise With Tech Stocks Seeing $100 Billion Swings
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. took this rocket ride on Monday, as the company’s stock soared, briefly boosting its market capitalization by roughly $100 billion at an intraday high, after the chipmaker signed a deal with OpenAI that could lead to billions of dollars in revenue.  This follows a 36% jump in Oracle Corp. shares last month, which added $255 billion to the software firm’s market value in a single session, after it gave blockbuster guidance for its cloud business, including an agreement with the ChatGPT operator worth $300 billion over five years.

headline: NATO CCDCOE to Research Battlefield Connectivity with Oracle 5G Solutions
summary: The NATO Cooperative Cyber Defence Centre of Excellence (CCDCOE) has chosen Oracle and Oracle partner Druid Software to design, deploy, and secure private 5G networks for NATO research, war gaming, and development initiatives. The technologies will be pivotal in helping enable high-performance connectivity for cyber defence exercises that protect critical infrastructure from external threats.
